title: Types of Movies and TV Shows
summary: Essential vocabulary to talk about different genres of films and television programs, including descriptions and examples.

sections.heading: Movie Genres
sections.content: This section covers different types of movies with descriptions and examples.

examples.definition: A film or TV show intended to be funny.
examples.example: The comedy was so funny that we couldn't stop laughing.

examples.definition: Fast-paced movie with fighting and exciting scenes.
examples.example: I don't enjoy action films; I find them too violent.

examples.definition: Romantic comedy where main characters fall in love.
examples.example: At the end of the rom-com, the two main characters got married.

examples.definition: Frightening movie intended to scare the audience.
examples.example: After watching the scary horror film, I was afraid to turn off the light.

examples.definition: Movie about futuristic ideas or technology.
examples.example: I watched an excellent sci-fi film set in space in the year 4099.

sections.heading: More Movie Genres
sections.content: Additional types of movies with their descriptions.

examples.definition: Movie where part of the story is told through songs.
examples.example: I love watching musicals and singing along to the songs.
The thriller was so exciting that I couldn't take my eyes off the screen.

examples.definition: Cowboy movie set in 19th century mid-west USA.
examples.example: When I was a kid I loved cowboys, so I watched a lot of westerns.
We watched a fun family film last night that everyone enjoyed.

sections.heading: TV Show Types
sections.content: Vocabulary for different types of television programs.

examples.definition: Show with many episodes shown regularly.
examples.example: It's one of my favourite TV series; I've seen every episode at least three times.

examples.definition: Comedy program with regular characters in amusing situations.
examples.example: We watched a funny new sitcom on Saturday night.

examples.definition: Show focusing on ordinary people in everyday situations.
examples.example: There aren't any actors in reality shows, they're just normal people playing themselves.

examples.definition: Factual program about a person, event, or topic.
examples.example: We watched a fascinating documentary about the sinking of the Titanic.

examples.definition: Show where people play games to win money.
examples.example: I saw a new game show where the guests have to answer mathematical problems.

examples.definition: Show where people compete by singing, dancing, etc.
examples.example: The winner of the talent show had a beautiful singing voice.

examples.definition: Factual program focusing on animals and nature.
examples.example: I watched a great wildlife show on sharks last weekend.

examples.definition: Program covering sports news and events.
examples.example: The host of the sports show was discussing the match with the team's coach.
